Class Charts

  • public final class Charts
extends Object
    A façade class for common ChartOuterClass.Chart-related operations.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson

    • Method Detail

      • install

        public static final Future<ReleaseOuterClass.Release> install(URL chartUrl)
                                                       throws IOException
        Using a Tiller constructed just in time for communication with the Tiller component of the Helm ecosystem, installs the Helm chart located at the supplied URL with default options.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        chartUrl - a URL that designates a Helm chart; must not be null; will be loaded with a URLChartLoader
        Returns:
        a Future whose Future.get() method will return the ReleaseOuterClass.Release representing the chart that was installed
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs
        KubernetesClientException - if there is a problem with Kubernetes communication itself
        NullPointerException - if either tiller or chartUrl is null
        See Also:
        install(Tiller, URL, boolean, boolean, String, String, boolean, long, String, boolean), Tiller

      • install

        public static final Future<ReleaseOuterClass.Release> install(Tiller tiller,
                                                              URL chartUrl)
                                                       throws IOException
        Using the supplied Tiller for communication with the Tiller component of the Helm ecosystem, installs the Helm chart located at the supplied URL with the supplied options.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        tiller - a Tiller instance to use to communicate with Tiller; must not be null
        chartUrl - a URL that designates a Helm chart; must not be null; will be loaded with a URLChartLoader
        Returns:
        a Future whose Future.get() method will return the ReleaseOuterClass.Release representing the chart that was installed
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs
        KubernetesClientException - if there is a problem with Kubernetes communication itself
        NullPointerException - if either tiller or chartUrl is null
        See Also:
        install(Tiller, URL, boolean, boolean, String, String, boolean, long, String, boolean), Tiller

      • install

        public static final Future<ReleaseOuterClass.Release> install(URL chartUrl,
                                                              String yamlValues,
                                                              boolean wait)
                                                       throws IOException
        Using a Tiller constructed just in time for communication with the Tiller component of the Helm ecosystem, installs the Helm chart located at the supplied URL with the supplied options.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        chartUrl - a URL that designates a Helm chart; must not be null; will be loaded with a URLChartLoader
        yamlValues - a YAML-formatted String representing values to override in the chart; may be null
        wait - whether to wait for Pods and Services and such to become Ready before the returned Future's Future.get() method will return a ReleaseOuterClass.Release
        Returns:
        a Future whose Future.get() method will return the ReleaseOuterClass.Release representing the chart that was installed
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs
        KubernetesClientException - if there is a problem with Kubernetes communication itself
        NullPointerException - if either tiller or chartUrl is null
        See Also:
        install(Tiller, URL, boolean, boolean, String, String, boolean, long, String, boolean), Tiller

      • install

        public static final Future<ReleaseOuterClass.Release> install(Tiller tiller,
                                                              URL chartUrl,
                                                              String yamlValues,
                                                              boolean wait)
                                                       throws IOException
        Using the supplied Tiller for communication with the Tiller component of the Helm ecosystem, installs the Helm chart located at the supplied URL with the supplied options.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        tiller - a Tiller instance to use to communicate with Tiller; must not be null
        chartUrl - a URL that designates a Helm chart; must not be null; will be loaded with a URLChartLoader
        yamlValues - a YAML-formatted String representing values to override in the chart; may be null
        wait - whether to wait for Pods and Services and such to become Ready before the returned Future's Future.get() method will return a ReleaseOuterClass.Release
        Returns:
        a Future whose Future.get() method will return the ReleaseOuterClass.Release representing the chart that was installed
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs
        KubernetesClientException - if there is a problem with Kubernetes communication itself
        NullPointerException - if either tiller or chartUrl is null
        See Also:
        install(Tiller, URL, boolean, boolean, String, String, boolean, long, String, boolean), Tiller

      • install

        public static final Future<ReleaseOuterClass.Release> install(URL chartUrl,
                                                              boolean disableHooks,
                                                              boolean dryRun,
                                                              String releaseName,
                                                              String releaseNamespace,
                                                              boolean reuseReleaseName,
                                                              long timeoutInSeconds,
                                                              String yamlValues,
                                                              boolean wait)
                                                       throws IOException
        Using a Tiller constructed just in time for communication with the Tiller component of the Helm ecosystem, installs the Helm chart located at the supplied URL with the supplied options.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        chartUrl - a URL that designates a Helm chart; must not be null; will be loaded with a URLChartLoader
        disableHooks - whether the chart's hooks should be disabled
        dryRun - if true then no installation will take place, and a Future whose Future.get() method may return null will be returned
        releaseName - the name of the release; if null or empty then a generated name will be used instead
        releaseNamespace - the namespace into which the release should be installed; if null or empty default will be used instead
        reuseReleaseName - whether to silently replace any extant release with the same releaseName (not suitable for production)
        timeoutInSeconds - the number of seconds after which any Kubernetes operations will time out; set in the Helm project to 300L by default
        yamlValues - a YAML-formatted String representing values to override in the chart; may be null
        wait - whether to wait for Pods and Services and such to become Ready before the returned Future's Future.get() method will return a ReleaseOuterClass.Release
        Returns:
        a Future whose Future.get() method will return the ReleaseOuterClass.Release representing the chart that was installed
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs
        KubernetesClientException - if there is a problem with Kubernetes communication itself
        NullPointerException - if either tiller or chartUrl is null
        See Also:
        install(Tiller, URL, boolean, boolean, String, String, boolean, long, String, boolean), Tiller

      • install

        public static final Future<ReleaseOuterClass.Release> install(Tiller tiller,
                                                              URL chartUrl,
                                                              boolean disableHooks,
                                                              boolean dryRun,
                                                              String releaseName,
                                                              String releaseNamespace,
                                                              boolean reuseReleaseName,
                                                              long timeoutInSeconds,
                                                              String yamlValues,
                                                              boolean wait)
                                                       throws IOException
        Using the supplied Tiller for communication with the Tiller component of the Helm ecosystem, installs the Helm chart located at the supplied URL with the supplied options.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        tiller - a Tiller instance to use to communicate with Tiller; must not be null
        chartUrl - a URL that designates a Helm chart; must not be null; will be loaded with a URLChartLoader
        disableHooks - whether the chart's hooks should be disabled
        dryRun - if true then no installation will take place, and a Future whose Future.get() method may return null will be returned
        releaseName - the name of the release; if null or empty then a generated name will be used instead
        releaseNamespace - the namespace into which the release should be installed; if null or empty default will be used instead
        reuseReleaseName - whether to silently replace any extant release with the same releaseName (not suitable for production)
        timeoutInSeconds - the number of seconds after which any Kubernetes operations will time out; set in the Helm project to 300L by default
        yamlValues - a YAML-formatted String representing values to override in the chart; may be null
        wait - whether to wait for Pods and Services and such to become Ready before the returned Future's Future.get() method will return a ReleaseOuterClass.Release
        Returns:
        a Future whose Future.get() method will return the ReleaseOuterClass.Release representing the chart that was installed
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs
        KubernetesClientException - if there is a problem with Kubernetes communication itself
        NullPointerException - if either tiller or chartUrl is null
        See Also:
        Tiller
